settings.heading: GET TO KNOW OUR DIFFUSER SCENTS

settings.title: Are your essential oils 100% pure?
settings.content: Yes. Our oils are 100% pure with absolutely no fillers, diluting oils, synthetic fragrances, or unnatural components of any kind.

settings.title: Where are your oils sourced from?
settings.content: We source essential oils from countries around the world. We choose places that make the highest-quality products—so that we can bring the best essential oils from around the globe directly to you.

settings.title: Can I diffuse essential oils around my pets?
settings.content:
Our pets are as unique as us. The first thing we suggest doing is checking with your vet—your animal may be more sensitive than others, so your vet will know best.

Stronger scents such as Lemon, Grapefruit, Peppermint, and Boost, should be used sparingly. If you would still like to diffuse one of these scents, I would suggest limiting the number of drops to approximately 1-5 drops.

Frankincense, Lavender, and Cedarwood are great options to diffuse around animals. We also suggest turning your diffuser off when your animals are home alone, just in case they do become agitated by the scent.

For more information, visit our page here.

settings.title: Which oils are safe for pregnancy and babies?
settings.content:
The best thing to do before using essential oils is to chat with your doctor.

In a diffuser, we recommend using small amounts of essential oils when pregnant (about 5 drops). When it comes to newborns, we recommend waiting 3 months before using essential oils. But your doctor will know best, as we all react differently.
Always opt for essential oils that are 100% pure, vegan, cruelty-free, and free from synthetic fragrance.


These are the products we recommend starting with once you’ve spoken to your doctor: Lavender, Bergamot, Grapefruit, Lemon, Frankincense, Cedarwood, Boost, Sleep.

settings.title: Is your packaging and bottles recyclable?
settings.content: Yes. Our packaging is all 100% recyclable, reusable, or biodegradable, and our bottles are printed using plant-based ink.

settings.title: Are your essential oils therapeutic grade?
settings.content:
Therapeutic grade is not an industry standard—it’s a trademarked term used to describe certain companies’ products. We prefer to speak about the quality of our products without buzzwords or marketing slogans.

Our oils are 100% pure, and are free from fillers, diluting oils, synthetic fragrances, and unnatural components of any kind.

settings.title: Why is my Glow Diffuser not misting?
settings.content:
There may be a few reasons why your diffuser isn’t misting properly. Here are some ways to troubleshoot the issue.

First, give your diffuser a deep clean. As a part of a built-in feature to protect our diffusers, the unit won’t run if the ultrasonic plates are clogged with essential oils. Watch our video above for instructions on how to clean your diffuser.

Next, make sure the water is filled to just below the line inside the reservoir. If there is too little or too much water in the reservoir, the diffuser won’t turn on.

settings.title: Why is my Glow Diffuser not misting for the full 4-hour or 8-hour time cycle?
settings.content: In order for your diffuser to run for the full time cycle, ensure that the water is filled to just below the fill line. In addition, environmental factors—such as the humidity in your space and the type of water used—may affect the run times by approximately 15%. If you notice a large discrepancy in run time, please reach out to us at hello@vitruvi.com.

settings.title: Why is my Glow Diffuser not turning on?
settings.content:
Make sure you’re using the original power cord that came with your Glow Diffuser. If you misplaced your power cord, don’t worry—we sell replacement parts here. We also suggest plugging your diffuser into a different outlet to ensure it’s not an issue with your power source.

Next, ensure that the water is filled to just below the fill line. If the internal sensor notices that there is too little water in the reservoir, the diffuser will not turn on. Also, make sure that the Glow Diffuser cover is sitting completely flush on the base.

settings.title: Does my Glow Diffuser come with a warranty?
settings.content:
Yes: the Glow Diffuser comes with a lifetime warranty. If your diffuser has any mechanical or manufacturing defects, we would be happy to assist you. Please get in touch with us at hello@vitruvi.com.

Please note that our lifetime device warranty does not cover personal damages. That said, if you need a replacement part, you’re able to purchase it here.
